### Seattle Postpartum Health Study

<img align="right" width="350" hspace = "20" src=clipart_FB.jpg>

<font size="4"> As co-principal investigator of the Seattle Postpartum Health Study, I was directly responsible for every aspect of the project, including the following: <br /> <font size="3">

1. Study design <br />
2. Grant writing (funded by [NSF](https://www.nsf.gov/pubs/2005/nsf05607/nsf05607.htm){target="_blank"} and [Wenner-Gren Foundation](http://www.wennergren.org/programs/dissertation-fieldwork-grants){target="_blank"}) <br />
3. IRB approval <br />
4. Negotiated logistics of running project across two institutions <br />
5. Informed consent forms <br />
6. Data management plan <br />
7. Participant recruitment <br />
8. Data collection (including biospecimens) <br />
9. Research personnel management <br />
10. Corresponding wet lab work <br />
11. Corresponding data analysis and manuscript preparation <br />

### Tsimane Health and Life History Project

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=Picture2.jpg>

<font size="4"> As a graduate researcher for the Tsimane Health and Life History Project, I utilized pre-existing data to conduct a series of computational studies looking at how ecological conditions (e.g., parasite burden) drive population-level differences in immune function across reproductive states (e.g., pregnancy). This involved: <br /> <font size="3">

1. Study design <br />
2. Grant writing (funding obtained from the [NSF](https://www.nsfgrfp.org/){target="_blank"}) <br />
3. Extensive data cleaning <br />
4. Bayesian modelling <br />
5. Manuscript preparation (see [Publications](Publications.html){target="_blank"}) <br />

### Incline Study

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=Incline.jpg>

<font size="4"> As a Post Baccalaureate Research Fellow, I worked with [Dr Cara Wall-Scheffler](https://wallscheffler.wordpress.com/){target="_blank"} to collect energetic and thermoregulation data for  a study investigating the effects of sex and terrain (i.e., incline) on optimal walking speed and cost of transport (results published [here](https://academic.oup.com/icb/article/55/6/1155/2363610){target="_blank"}).<br /> <font size="3">

1. Participant recruitment <br />
2. All data collection <br />
3. Dissemination of results at conferences

### Women's Health Initiative

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=WHI.jpg>

<font size="4"> As a data technician for the Women's Health Initiative at [Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Institute](https://www.fredhutch.org/en.html){target="_blank"}, I was responsible for:<br /> <font size="3">

1. Participant retention/follow-up
2. Coordination of research personnel conference calls
3. Data cleaning/QC
